title: Sikta Irrigation Project Corruption Case
description:
This case involves allegations of significant corruption and negligence in the construction of the main canal of the Sikta Irrigation Project, a designated National Pride Project in Banke District. The Commission for the Investigation of Abuse of Authority (CIAA) filed a case at the Special Court on December 7, 2018, against 21 individuals, including former minister Bikram Pandey, the head of the contracting firm CTCE Kalika Construction JV.

The core allegation is that the defendants knowingly engaged in substandard construction using faulty designs and low-quality materials despite being aware of problematic soil conditions. Feasibility studies from as early as 1980 had identified the presence of 'dispersive soil,' which is highly erodible and unsuitable for canal construction without special measures. These warnings were allegedly ignored, leading to repeated collapses of the main canal during testing in June 2016 and July 2018. The CIAA sought to recover a total of NPR 8.59 billion in damages.

On June 19, 2022, the Special Court acquitted all 21 defendants. The court ruled that the canal's collapse was due to unforeseen technical issues related to the dispersive soil, which it claimed the defendants were not aware of during the design and construction phases. The court classified the issue as a matter of civil liability rather than criminal corruption.

Disagreeing with the verdict, the CIAA filed an appeal at the Supreme Court on April 4, 2023. In January 2025, the Supreme Court accepted the appeal for a full judicial review, stating that the Special Court's decision was 'worth consideration' as evidence suggested the soil issues were previously documented. The case is currently sub-judice at the Supreme Court.
unverified_info:
There are slight variations in the total corruption amount cited across different news reports. While the CIAA charge-sheet specifies a claim of NPR 8.59 billion, some sources mention figures like 'over NPR 2 billion' or 'NPR 8.32 billion'.

Additionally, there is an unconfirmed allegation mentioned in one news report that the consulting company, ERMC-ITECO Nepal JV, may have used falsified curricula vitae (CVs) for its experts to secure the project's consultancy contract.
key_allegations: Substandard construction of the main canal using low-quality materials and faulty designs.
Willful negligence of warnings from prior feasibility studies (1980, 2004) about problematic 'dispersive soil' conditions.
Failure in project design and supervision by project officials, consultants, and the contractor.
Causing a financial loss of NPR 8,598,800,000 to the state due to repeated canal collapses.
related_entities: Commission for the Investigation of Abuse of Authority (CIAA)

timeline.title: Initial Feasibility Study
timeline.description: A feasibility study conducted by Lahmeyer International GMBH reportedly identifies the presence of dispersive soil in the project area, posing a risk to construction.

timeline.title: Second Feasibility Study
timeline.description: Another feasibility study allegedly reiterates the findings of problematic soil conditions in the project area.

timeline.title: First Canal Collapse
timeline.description: The main canal of the Sikta Irrigation Project collapses at multiple sections during its first trial run, even with water flow below its design capacity.

timeline.title: Second Canal Collapse
timeline.description: After repairs, the canal collapses again during another test phase, confirming severe structural and soil-related issues.

timeline.title: CIAA Files Corruption Case
timeline.description: The CIAA files a corruption case at the Special Court against 21 individuals, including contractor Bikram Pandey, seeking NPR 8.59 billion in damages.

timeline.title: Special Court Acquits All Accused
timeline.description: A joint bench of the Special Court, led by Chairperson Sri Kanta Poudel, acquits all 21 accused, ruling that the canal collapse was due to unforeseen technical issues, not corruption.

timeline.title: CIAA Appeals to Supreme Court
timeline.description: The CIAA challenges the Special Court's acquittal by filing an appeal at the Supreme Court, arguing that the verdict was flawed and ignored evidence.

timeline.title: Supreme Court Accepts Case for Review
timeline.description: The Supreme Court agrees to conduct a full judicial review of the Special Court's acquittal, finding the decision 'worth consideration' and summons the defendants.
